metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1851 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
OpenStack Cinder before 2014.1.5 (icehouse), 2014.2.x before 2014.2.4(juno), and 2015.1.x before 2015.1.1 (kilo) allows remote authenticatedusers to read arbitrary files via a crafted qcow2 signature in an image tothe upload-to-image command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1851` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cinder-api - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1
cinder-backup - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1
cinder-common - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1
cinder-scheduler - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1
cinder-volume - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1
python-cinder - 1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cinder package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1.5-0ubuntu1').
